intro: Monopsis simplex, commonly known as the simple monopsis, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is native to certain regions of South America, particularly in Brazil. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers that bloom in spring. It prefers moist, well-drained soils and full sun to partial shade. Due to its ornamental value and unique botanical features, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and by plant enthusiasts.
